race_comments: Jimmie Johnson won the Advance Auto Parts Clash at Daytona International Speedway, his second victory in the non-points paying Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series race. Prior to the start of the race, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: 9, 11 (backup).
Race is complete
Race is complete

Denny Hamlin won the 61st running Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway, his 32nd victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 27, 42 (transmission), 40 (rear gear).

Brad Keselowski won the Folds of Honor QuikTrip 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway, his 28th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #18 (backup car), #77 (multiple inspection failures)

Joey Logano won the Pennzoil 400 at Las Vegas Motor Speedway, his 22nd Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: No. 00 (gear change) and 13 (engine change).

Kyle Busch won the 15th running of the TicketGuardian 500 at ISM Raceway, his 52nd victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: None.

Kyle Busch won the 23rd Annual Auto Club 400, his 53rd victory in 504 Monster Energy Cup Series races. Prior to the start of the race, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #36 (engine change) and #34 (twice failed inspection).

Brad Keselowski won the 70th Annual STP 500 at Martinsville Speedway, his 29th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 32, 51 (backup car); Nos. 24, 77, 52 (inspection failure).

Denny Hamlin won the 23rd Annual O'Reilly Auto Parts 500 at Texas Motor Speedway, his 33rd victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following car(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: No. 8 (back up car) and No. 6 (multiple (2) pre-race inspection failures).

Kyle Busch won the Food City 500 at Bristol Motor Speedway, his 54th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #47 (backup car) and #4 (multiple inspection failures).

Martin Truex Jr. won the Toyota Owners 400 at Richmond Raceway, his 20th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #10, #20, #41, #48, #66, #9, #11, #36 (inspection failure).

Chase Elliott won the GEICO 500 at Talladega Superspeedway, his fourth Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #6, 11, 17, 18, 19, 20, 27, 51 (unapproved adjustments) and #62 (driver change).

Martin Truex Jr. won the Gander RV 400 at Dover International Speedway, his 21st victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 15, 27 (engine change); 19, 36, 47, 88 (multiple inspection failures).

Brad Keselowski won the 9th Annual Digital Ally 400, his 30th victory in 353 Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series races. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reason indicated: #00,9,10,13,19,22,34,41,42, 46 and #66 (failed inspection)

Kyle Larson won the Monster Energy Open at Charlotte Motor Speedway. his second victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series non-points event. Prior to the start of the race, no vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field. Stage 1 Winner: William Byron; Stage 2 Winner: Bubba Wallace.

Kyle Larson won the Monster Energy NASCAR All-Star Race at Charlotte Motor Speedway. his first victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series non-points event. Prior to the start of the race, no vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field.

Martin Truex Jr. won the 60th annual Coca-Cola 600 at Charlotte Motor Speedway, his 22nd victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 36 (multiple inspection failures).

Kyle Busch won the 38th running of the Pocono 400 at Pocono Raceway, his 55th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 95 (engine change) and 52 (unnapproved adjustments).
Joey Logano won the FireKeepers Casino 400 at Michigan International Speedway, his 23rd Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. No cars dropped to the rear prior to the start of the race.

Martin Truex Jr. won the 31st Annual Toyota/Save Mart 350 at Sonoma Raceway. His 23rd victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #41 (engine change), #20, 51 (unapproved adjustments) and #15 (driver change).

Alex Bowman won the 19th Annual Camping World 400 at Chicagoland Speedway, his first career win in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: #24 (engine change), #32 (transmission change) and #36 (inspection failure).

Justin Haley won the Coke Zero Sugar 400 at Daytona International Speedway. His first victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: No. 24 (Backup car), Nos. 42, 77, 53, 62, 51, 95 (unapproved adjustments).

Kurt Busch won the 9th Annual Quaker State 400  presented by Walmart at Kentucky Speedway, his 31st victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. Nos. 6, 77 (Failing inspection once).

Kevin Harvick won the Foxwoods Resort Casino 301 at New Hampshire Motor Speedway. His 46th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 6, 11, 24, 42, 88 (Backup car).

Denny Hamlin won the Gander RV 400 at Pocono Raceway, his 34th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #9, 42 (backup car), #43 (engine change), #3, 12, 15, 24, 27, 32, 34, 37, 48 (failed post-qualifying inspection).

Chase Elliott won the 34th Annual Go Bowling at The Glen at Watkins Glen International, his 5th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 12 (Unapproved adjustments).

Kevin Harvick won the Consumers Energy 400 at Michigan International Speedway. His 47th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 3, 8 (qualifying time disallowed), No. 19 (multiple inspection failures), Nos. 32, 36 (transmission change), No. 77 (driver change).

race_name: Bass Pro Shops NRA Night Race
race_comments: Denny Hamlin won the Bass Pro Shops NRA Night Race at Bristol Motor Speedway, his 35th career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race the following cars dropped to the rear under penalty for the reasons indicated: #54 and 77 (unapproved adjustments).

Erik Jones won the 70th Annual Bojangles' Southern 500 at Darlington Raceway, his second career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #10 (backup car), #18 (enginge change), #77 (transmission), #27 and 51 (unapproved adjustments).

race_name: Big Machine Vodka 400 at the Brickyard Powered By Florida Georgia Line
race_comments: Kevin Harvick won the Big Machine Vodka 400 at the Brickyard presented by Florida Georgia Line at Indianapolis Motor Speedway. His 48th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: No. 11 (backup car).

Martin Truex Jr. won the second annual South Point 400, his 24th career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race the following cars dropped to the rear under penalty for the reasons indicated: No. 36 and 37(unapproved adjustments) and No. 77 (transmission change).

Martin Truex Jr. won the Federated Auto Parts 400 at Richmond Raceway, his 25th Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race the following cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: #27 (unapproved adjustments), #43, 52 (failed post-qualifying inspection).

Chase Elliott won the Bank of America ROVAL 400 at the Charlotte Motor Speedway Road Course. His sixth victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reasons indicated: Nos. 11, 88, 96 (Backup Cars), No. 19 (Engine Change), No. 51 (Driver Change), No. 00 (Unapproved Adjustments).

Kyle Larson won the Drydene 400 at Dover International Speedway, his sixth victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, no vehicles dropped to the rear of the field under penalty.

Ryan Blaney won the 51st annual 1000Bulbs.com 500 at Talladega Superspeedway, his third career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race the following car dropped to the rear of the field under penalty for the reason indicated: No. 11 (engine change).

Denny Hamlin won the 19th annual Hollywood Casino 400 at Kansas Speedway. His 36th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, the following vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty: #51 (Unapproved Adjustments).

Martin Truex Jr. won the 71st Annual First Data 500, his 26th victory in 510 Monster Energy Cup Series races. Prior to the start of the race, the following cars dropped to the rear of the field for the reasons indicated: No. 6 (failed post-qualifying inspection), No. 9 (engine change), No. 32 (failed post-qualifying inspection), No. 51 (failed post-qualifying inspection) and No. 77 (failed post-qualifying inspection).

Kevin Harvick won the 15th annual AAA Texas 500 at Texas Motor Speedway, his 49th career Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series victory. Prior to the start of the race, no cars dropped to the rear of the field under penalty.

Denny Hamlin won the 32nd annual Bluegreen Vacations 500 at ISM Raceway. His 37th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, no vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty.

Kyle Busch won the 21st annual Ford EcoBoost 400 at Homestead-Miami Speedway. His 56th victory in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series. Prior to the start of the race, no vehicle(s) dropped to the rear of the field under penalty.
